personalization_prompt: What 3 reasons make being organized worth it for you?
details_md:
**The Experiment:** Walk through your space for 10 minutes noting stress points. Write a one‑sentence “Why I want to be organized.”

**Why it Works:** Naming *why* increases motivation and persistence; awareness reduces avoidance and guides effort.

**How to Try It:**
• Set a 10‑min timer and list 3 clutter hotspots
• Write your one‑sentence “why”
• Post it where you’ll see it daily

personalization_prompt: Describe your ideal room/desk and how it should feel.

personalization_config.placeholder: e.g., Clear desk, only laptop + notebook; calm, easy to focus

details_md:
**The Experiment:** Draft a short description or mini vision board of your ideal space.

**Why it Works:** A concrete target improves planning and effort; it also guides what to keep vs. let go.

**How to Try It:**
• Write a 3–5 sentence vision
• Add 1–2 photos (optional)
• Pick one area to align with that vision this week

summary: Use Decision Filters (Keep/Let‑Go Rules) Before You Start.
personalization_prompt: Write your 2–3 rules (filters) for this session.

items.label: Rule 1
items.placeholder: Keep only items used in last 12 months

details_md:
**The Experiment:** Set simple yes/no rules before decluttering.

**Why it Works:** Pre‑deciding reduces decision fatigue and speeds up sorting.

**How to Try It:**
• Write 2–3 filters
• Read them aloud
• Apply them item‑by‑item without renegotiating

personalization_prompt: Which small area will you blitz today?
details_md:
**The Experiment:** Set a 15‑min timer and sort with 4 containers: Keep / Donate / Trash / Move.

**Why it Works:** Short sprints build momentum; touching each item once prevents reshuffling.

**How to Try It:**
• Pick a tiny zone
• Start timer, sort fast using your filters
• Immediately bag Trash/Donate and relocate “Move” items

personalization_prompt: Which category will you do first?
details_md:
**The Experiment:** Gather one type of item from all rooms and decide what stays.

**Why it Works:** Seeing the whole category reveals duplicates and the true “top 20%.”

**How to Try It:**
• Choose one category (e.g., t‑shirts)
• Lay out all at once
• Keep favorites/essentials; donate the rest

summary: OHIO Paper Rule (Only Handle It Once).
personalization_prompt: Where will your paper inbox live?
details_md:
**The Experiment:** When you touch a paper, decide now: act, file, or toss. No piles.

**Why it Works:** Reduces postponed decisions; prevents “drift” into stacks.

**How to Try It:**
• Create a single paper inbox
• Process daily: action/file/recycle
• Go paperless where possible

personalization_prompt: Which item category will you apply this to first?
details_md:
**The Experiment:** For every new item you bring in, let one similar item go.

**Why it Works:** Controls inflow so clutter doesn’t rebound; preserves limited space.

**How to Try It:**
• Keep a donation box handy
• When buying, pre‑select what will go
• Drop off monthly

summary: Assign a Home to Every Item.
personalization_prompt: Pick one hotspot and list where each item “lives.”

personalization_config.placeholder: e.g., Keys → wall hook; Mail → entry tray; Chargers → drawer bin

details_md:
**The Experiment:** Choose logical, easy “homes” for things and label if needed.

**Why it Works:** When everything has a home, tidying becomes returning, not searching.

**How to Try It:**
• Map homes for a clutter zone
• Add labels/containers
• Do a 2‑min return‑to‑home each night

personalization_prompt: Which room will you zone (e.g., study, hobbies, mail)?
details_md:
**The Experiment:** Create zones (study, bills, crafts) and label bins/shelves accordingly.

**Why it Works:** “Like with like” reduces searching and lowers misplacement.

**How to Try It:**
• Pick one room
• Group related items
• Label shelves/bins to match usage

personalization_prompt: Which small area will you 5S?
details_md:
**The Experiment:** Run the 5S cycle on a micro‑space.

**Why it Works:** Standard steps prevent backslide and create repeatable order.

**How to Try It:**
• Sort out excess
• Set in order + Shine
• Create a simple daily/weekly reset rule

personalization_prompt: When will your reset happen each day?
details_md:
**The Experiment:** Do a daily 10‑minute tidy.

**Why it Works:** Prevents build‑up; small consistent effort beats occasional marathons.

**How to Try It:**
• Set a repeating alarm
• Tidy surfaces, return items home
• Stop at 10 min to keep it sustainable

personalization_prompt: List 3 tasks you’ll do immediately if < 2 minutes.
details_md:
**The Experiment:** If it takes under 2 minutes, do it now.

**Why it Works:** Kills micro‑clutter before it blossoms; reduces rework.

**How to Try It:**
• Post your 2‑minute list
• Practice at entry, sink, desk
• Celebrate quick wins

summary: Install a Key Hook + Entry Drop Zone.
personalization_prompt: Where will your keys and mail live?
details_md:
**The Experiment:** Create a dedicated entry spot for keys/mail.

**Why it Works:** Reduces lost items and instant clutter at the door.

**How to Try It:**
• Mount a hook or place a bowl
• Put keys/mail there every arrival
• Add small recycle bin for junk mail

personalization_prompt: What time cue will you use for making the bed?
details_md:
**The Experiment:** Tie bed‑making to a morning cue.

**Why it Works:** One quick win makes the whole room feel tidy; anchors identity.

**How to Try It:**
• Pick a cue
• Smooth duvet + pillows (≤2 min)
• Notice how it influences other tidying

summary: Wash/Load the Dish Right After Eating.
personalization_prompt: Which meal will you start with?
details_md:
**The Experiment:** No sink backlog: rinse and load immediately.

**Why it Works:** Prevents pile‑ups and sticky messes; removes a common hotspot.

**How to Try It:**
• Commit to one meal first
• Turn on music as a cue
• Expand to all meals this week

personalization_prompt: Pick a cue to reset (e.g., after brushing teeth).

personalization_config.placeholder: e.g., After brushing at night, put all items away + quick wipe

details_md:
**The Experiment:** Put toiletries away and wipe counter nightly.

**Why it Works:** Keeps a frequent‑use zone perpetually tidy; fast satisfaction.

**How to Try It:**
• Choose cue
• Place small caddy for items
• 2‑minute reset nightly

personalization_prompt: When is your recurring 30–60 min block?

personalization_config.placeholder: e.g., Saturdays 10–11am: closet or paper sweep

details_md:
**The Experiment:** Put a standing declutter/organize block on your calendar.

**Why it Works:** Scheduling increases follow‑through; reduces “I’ll do it later.”

**How to Try It:**
• Pick a day/time
• Name the block (e.g., “Maintenance Monday”)
• Treat it like an appointment

personalization_prompt: What project will you timebox this week?
details_md:
**The Experiment:** Give declutter projects strict time limits.

**Why it Works:** Prevents perfectionism and burnout; makes starting easier.

**How to Try It:**
• Choose a task
• Set an end time now
• Stop on time; schedule next box if needed

summary: Capture Tasks in a Trusted List (GTD‑Lite).
personalization_prompt: Where will you capture tasks?
details_md:
**The Experiment:** Get to‑dos out of your head into one place.

**Why it Works:** Reduces mental clutter; objects needn’t sit out as reminders.

**How to Try It:**
• Pick one capture tool
• Daily: brain dump + choose 1–3 next actions
• Weekly review/clean up

summary: Set a Physical Inbox Tray for All Papers.
personalization_prompt: Where will your single inbox live?

personalization_config.placeholder: e.g., Left corner of desk with labeled tray

details_md:
**The Experiment:** One tray for all incoming paper; process it weekly.

**Why it Works:** Containment stops spread; pairs with OHIO rule.

**How to Try It:**
• Place a tray
• Dump all paper there
• Weekly: empty it completely

summary: Use a Simple Kanban Board (To‑Do / Doing / Done).
personalization_prompt: Where will you set your board?
details_md:
**The Experiment:** Visualize tasks and limit work in progress.

**Why it Works:** Visibility reduces overwhelm; moving to “Done” is rewarding.

**How to Try It:**
• Create 3 columns
• Add only 1–3 “Doing” tasks
• Review/clean weekly

summary: Place a Donation Box in a Closet.
personalization_prompt: Which closet will host your donation box?
details_md:
**The Experiment:** Keep a labeled box for immediate donate decisions.

**Why it Works:** Frictionless letting‑go; batches drop‑offs.

**How to Try It:**
• Add a sturdy box + label
• Drop items as found
• Schedule a monthly drop‑off

personalization_prompt: What will trigger your 30‑day list?

personalization_config.placeholder: e.g., Any non‑essential item over $20 goes to a 30‑day list

details_md:
**The Experiment:** Write wants on a 30‑day list before buying.

**Why it Works:** Cools impulse buys; prevents new clutter from entering.

**How to Try It:**
• Create a “30‑day” note
• Add item + date + why
• Revisit after 30 days

personalization_prompt: Pick your sprint time and folder names.
details_md:
**The Experiment:** Rapidly triage email for 20 minutes.

**Why it Works:** Clears digital clutter; reduces anxiety and lost tasks.

**How to Try It:**
• Sort by sender/topic
• Mass archive/delete non‑essentials
• Move must‑dos to “Action”

personalization_prompt: Pick 5 senders to unsubscribe now.

personalization_config.placeholder: e.g., “Daily Deals”, “Brand X”, “Newsletters I don’t read”

details_md:
**The Experiment:** Reduce inflow with 5 unsubscribes and simple filters.

**Why it Works:** Lower inflow = less to manage; inbox stays cleaner.

**How to Try It:**
• Unsubscribe from 5 bulk senders
• Create 1–2 filters (e.g., receipts → Receipts)
• Repeat monthly

personalization_prompt: What 2–3 top‑level folders will you use?
details_md:
**The Experiment:** Clear your desktop; file or delete obvious clutter.

**Why it Works:** Visual calm improves focus; saves search time.

**How to Try It:**
• Make a temporary “To Sort” folder
• Delete duplicates/junk
• File remaining into 2–3 folders

personalization_prompt: Which 3 apps will you silence or remove?
details_md:
**The Experiment:** Turn off non‑essential notifications and delete 3 unused apps.

**Why it Works:** Cuts digital noise that drives distraction and “mental clutter.”

**How to Try It:**
• Silence badges/banners for low‑value apps
• Delete 3 unused apps
• Reassess monthly

personalization_prompt: Which day/time will you schedule backups?

personalization_config.placeholder: e.g., 1st Sunday 5pm – run backup & clear camera roll

details_md:
**The Experiment:** Back up devices monthly and clear redundant photos.

**Why it Works:** Protects info; reduces hoarding duplicates “just in case.”

**How to Try It:**
• Schedule a recurring reminder
• Run backup
• Delete blurry/duplicate photos

personalization_prompt: What’s your 7‑word anti‑perfection mantra?

personalization_config.placeholder: e.g., “Small steps now beat perfect later.”

details_md:
**The Experiment:** Use a short mantra when you feel stuck.

**Why it Works:** Counters perfectionism that fuels procrastination.

**How to Try It:**
• Write your 7‑word script
• Post it at a clutter hotspot
• Say it before you start

personalization_prompt: What size limit will you set (e.g., 1 shoebox)?
details_md:
**The Experiment:** Keep a small box for top‑tier memories; photograph others.

**Why it Works:** Honors meaning without keeping everything.

**How to Try It:**
• Choose a box size
• Curate favorites only
• Photo + let go of the rest

personalization_prompt: Who will you invite (in‑person or virtual)?

personalization_config.placeholder: e.g., Friend on FaceTime for 30‑min co‑clean

details_md:
**The Experiment:** Clean alongside someone (in‑person or video) for focus.

**Why it Works:** Social accountability boosts initiation and staying power.

**How to Try It:**
• Schedule a 30‑min slot
• Share a before/after pic
• Celebrate wins together

personalization_prompt: Pick your next seasonal purge date.
details_md:
**The Experiment:** Do a quarterly sweep for items to donate/recycle.

**Why it Works:** Prevents slow creep; resets systems.

**How to Try It:**
• Put dates on calendar
• Target closets, drawers, surfaces
• Book donation pickup in advance

summary: Relapse Plan: Pick a Hotspot & a 10‑min Fix.
personalization_prompt: Which hotspot and what’s the 10‑min fix?
details_md:
**The Experiment:** Assume clutter will reappear; plan a mini reset.

**Why it Works:** Normalizes setbacks; speeds recovery.

**How to Try It:**
• Identify 1 hotspot
• Define a 10‑min fix
• Schedule it 2–3×/week

personalization_prompt: What will you automate first?
details_md:
**The Experiment:** Use tech or schedules to take chores off your plate.

**Why it Works:** Less willpower needed = steadier maintenance.

**How to Try It:**
• Choose one automation
• Set schedule/rule today
• Review in 2 weeks and tweak

personalization_prompt: Which bill will you switch to auto‑pay/e‑statements first?
details_md:
**The Experiment:** Turn on auto‑pay and go paperless for one account.

**Why it Works:** Cuts paper inflow; fewer piles and missed payments.

**How to Try It:**
• Log into provider
• Enable auto‑pay + e‑bills
• Repeat monthly for others

summary: If‑Then Rules for Common Clutter Triggers.
personalization_prompt: Write two If‑Then scripts.

items.label: If:
items.placeholder: e.g., If I bring in a package…

items.label: Then:
items.placeholder: …then I recycle the box same day

items.label: If:
items.placeholder: If I drop clothes on a chair…

details_md:
**The Experiment:** Pre‑decide responses to your clutter hotspots.

**Why it Works:** Implementation intentions make the response automatic; reduces willpower.

**How to Try It:**
• Identify 2 triggers
• Write matching actions
• Post near the hotspot

personalization_prompt: Pick your weekly review slot and checklist items.

items.label: Checklist
items.placeholder: e.g., Empty inbox tray, plan meals, tidy desk

details_md:
**The Experiment:** Pair a tidy sprint with planning and a small celebration.

**Why it Works:** Regular reflection sustains systems; reward locks habit in.

**How to Try It:**
• Schedule the slot
• Run your checklist
• Note 1 win; enjoy a small reward

summary: Habit Tracker: Don’t Break the Chain.
personalization_prompt: Which 2–3 habits will you track?
details_md:
**The Experiment:** Mark an X each day you complete your tidy habits.

**Why it Works:** Visible streaks are motivating; reinforces identity.

**How to Try It:**
• Print a 30‑day grid
• Cross off each day
• Protect streaks (skip once, never twice)

personalization_prompt: List 3 ways life is better & 1 future benefit.
details_md:
**The Experiment:** Tour your space and note wins; write one future benefit.

**Why it Works:** Gratitude reinforces the habit loop; vision sustains effort.

**How to Try It:**
• Walkthrough and name 3 wins
• Write one future payoff
• Re‑read monthly

summary: Name the cost of clutter (stress, time, money).
personalization_prompt: List 3 ways clutter is costing you right now.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Write 3 concrete costs (e.g., minutes lost daily, anxiety spikes).
**Why:** Making hidden costs explicit boosts motivation.
**Try:** Post the list where clutter starts to build.

summary: Before photo now, after photo later.
personalization_prompt: Snap 2–4 photos of one messy spot.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Photograph a space before any change.
**Why:** Visual feedback amplifies progress; reduces avoidance.
**Try:** Re‑shoot after 15–30 min of tidying and compare.

personalization_prompt: Where and when does clutter start?
details_md:
**Experiment:** Keep a 7‑day log of where clutter appears and what preceded it.
**Why:** Pattern spotting enables targeted fixes.
**Try:** Note time, place, feeling; pick 1 trigger to address next week.

personalization_prompt: Draft a 1‑sentence reframe for messy moments.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Replace “I’m a mess” with “I’m learning tidy habits.”
**Why:** Reduces shame→avoidance loop.
**Try:** Put the script on a hotspot.

personalization_prompt: Write 3 indicators a room is ‘done’.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Specify outcomes (e.g., clear surfaces, labeled bins, floor visible).
**Why:** Clarity reduces perfectionism and decision fatigue.
**Try:** Use checklist during sessions.

personalization_prompt: Which area, if fixed, improves your day most?
details_md:
**Experiment:** Choose one high‑impact zone (entry, desk, sink).
**Why:** Early wins fuel adherence.
**Try:** Allocate first 3 sessions there.

personalization_prompt: Draft Now/Next/Later for your top zone.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Outline 1–2 actions for each horizon.
**Why:** Sequencing converts goals to motion.
**Try:** Revisit weekly and move items forward.

personalization_prompt: Which barrier shows up most for you?
details_md:
**Experiment:** Say it out loud: “This is perfectionism.”
**Why:** Naming reduces its power; enables targeted strategy.
**Try:** Pair with a counter‑script (Progress > Perfection).

personalization_prompt: What’s the 2‑minute ‘first move’ for your task?
details_md:
**Experiment:** Start with a laughably small step.
**Why:** Lowers activation energy; builds momentum.
**Try:** Stop after 2 min or continue if energized.

personalization_prompt: Pick 1 unused expensive item to release.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Acknowledge the money is gone; free the space.
**Why:** Counters sunk‑cost bias; reduces guilt.
**Try:** Sell/donate this week.

personalization_prompt: Photograph 3 sentimental items; release 1.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Keep the memory, not the bulk.
**Why:** Photos preserve meaning; declutters gently.
**Try:** Create a digital ‘heritage’ album.

personalization_prompt: Which area will you four‑box today?
details_md:
**Experiment:** Keep/Donate/Trash/Relocate sprints.
**Why:** Forces decisions; prevents reshuffling.
**Try:** Set a 20–30 min timer and finish.

personalization_prompt: Pick 1 category to gather from all rooms.
details_md:
**Experiment:** See total volume, then choose favorites.
**Why:** Exposes duplicates; easier letting‑go.
**Try:** Keep top 20%, donate the rest.

personalization_prompt: Pick a box; label a 3–6 month review date.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Store undecided items with a future commitment.
**Why:** Reduces friction now; yields confident release later.
**Try:** Donate unopened at date.

personalization_prompt: Scan a shelf: anything unused past/future 90 days?
details_md:
**Experiment:** Apply a clear use window.
**Why:** Simple heuristic speeds choices.
**Try:** Remove fails immediately.

personalization_prompt: Pick a hotspot; define homes for each item there.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Assign logical homes, label as needed.
**Why:** Tidying becomes ‘returning’ not ‘searching’.
**Try:** Do a 2‑min nightly ‘return to home’.

summary: Make it obvious: visibility for daily tools.
personalization_prompt: Choose 3 daily‑use items to make easy to grab.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Place at eye level or in open trays.
**Why:** Reduces friction and forgetfulness.
**Try:** Hide rarely‑used to cut visual noise.

personalization_prompt: What can move off floors/counters onto walls?
details_md:
**Experiment:** Add hooks/shelves/over‑door storage.
**Why:** Clears surfaces; improves flow.
**Try:** Start with entry or laundry.

personalization_prompt: Tie bed‑making to a morning cue.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Make bed right after dressing/coffee.
**Why:** Sets tidy tone; quick win.
**Try:** ≤2 minutes.

personalization_prompt: Choose a meal to always clear immediately.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Rinse/load right after eating.
**Why:** Prevents pile‑ups; removes hotspot.
**Try:** Add music cue.

personalization_prompt: Set a daily 5‑min tidy alarm.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Quick circuit returning items home.
**Why:** Stops creep; lowers morning stress.
**Try:** Make it a family mini‑game.

personalization_prompt: Pick 2 weekly 30‑min blocks.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Add recurring events named ‘Reset’.
**Why:** Planning beats ‘when I have time’.
**Try:** Treat as an appointment.

personalization_prompt: Which area will you do for one Pomodoro?
details_md:
**Experiment:** 25 min focus + 5 min break.
**Why:** Urgency + rest = momentum.
**Try:** Do 1–3 rounds.

personalization_prompt: List 3 end‑of‑day ‘closing’ actions.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Define closure (clear desk, dishwash, toys away).
**Why:** Start next day fresh.
**Try:** Tie to a fixed time.

personalization_prompt: Which bill will you switch to e‑statements?
details_md:
**Experiment:** Turn on e‑bills + auto‑pay.
**Why:** Cuts paper inflow.
**Try:** Repeat monthly.

personalization_prompt: Name 5 unwanted senders to remove.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Unsubscribe + create 1 filter.
**Why:** Less inflow to triage.
**Try:** Repeat monthly.

personalization_prompt: Pick 10 papers to scan then recycle.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Digitize essentials; eliminate paper bulk.
**Why:** Searchable + backed up.
**Try:** Keep originals only when required.

personalization_prompt: Draft 5 steps for a weekly review.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Tidy, process inbox, plan next actions, calendar review, celebrate.
**Why:** Keeps systems trusted.
**Try:** Same time weekly.

personalization_prompt: Set a max of 2–3 ‘Doing’ tasks.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Cap work‑in‑progress on your board.
**Why:** Reduces overwhelm; increases finish rate.
**Try:** Move one to Done before adding more.

personalization_prompt: Which surface will you clear at first sign of buildup?
details_md:
**Experiment:** Intervene when first 1–2 items land.
**Why:** Clutter breeds clutter; early action is easy.
**Try:** 30‑sec micro‑resets.

personalization_prompt: List weekly tasks and assignments.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Assign & rotate duties; track visibly.
**Why:** Social accountability; fewer bottlenecks.
**Try:** 10‑min family reset nightly.

personalization_prompt: Pick a quarterly declutter date.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Schedule closet/drawer sweeps.
**Why:** Prevents slow creep.
**Try:** Book donation pickup in advance.

personalization_prompt: Choose a task to automate/schedule.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Robot vacuum or scheduled reminders.
**Why:** Less willpower, steadier upkeep.
**Try:** Review after 2 weeks.

personalization_prompt: Write 2 if‑then scripts for clutter traps.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Pre‑decide actions (e.g., package→break down box same day).
**Why:** Implementation intentions become automatic.
**Try:** Post near hotspot.

personalization_prompt: What triggers your 30‑day wait?
details_md:
**Experiment:** Add wants to a dated list; revisit later.
**Why:** Cools impulses; prevents new clutter.
**Try:** One‑in/one‑out when you do buy.

personalization_prompt: Pick a category; reduce duplicates by half.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Keep best; donate the rest.
**Why:** Less to store/track; frees space.
**Try:** Start with mugs, towels, or cables.

personalization_prompt: Remove 1 low‑value recurring commitment.
details_md:
**Experiment:** Free time to maintain space and rest.
**Why:** Less time‑pressure → less clutter.
**Try:** Replace with a weekly reset block.
